IssueTriggerStrategy.description: The strategy uses to open the issue

connections.description: A pattern to match on the connection name or array of connection IDs. Use `*` as wildcard.

TransformationExecutionLogLevel.description: The minimum log level to open the issue on

transformations.description: A pattern to match on the transformation name or array of transformation IDs. Use `*` as wildcard.

IssueTriggerBackpressureDelay.description: The minimum delay (backpressure) to open the issue for min of 1 minute (60000) and max of 1 day (86400000)

destinations.description: A pattern to match on the destination name or array of destination IDs. Use `*` as wildcard.

IssueTriggerReference.description: Configuration object for the specific issue type selected

IssueTriggerSlackChannel.description: Slack channel for an issue trigger

IssueTriggerIntegrationChannel.description: Integration channel for an issue trigger

IssueTriggerEmailChannel.description: Email channel for an issue trigger

IssueTriggerChannels.description: Notification channels object for the specific channel type

name.description: Optional unique name to use as reference when using the API

disabled_at.description: ISO timestamp for when the issue trigger was disabled

updated_at.description: ISO timestamp for when the issue trigger was last updated

created_at.description: ISO timestamp for when the issue trigger was created

deleted_at.description: ISO timestamp for when the issue trigger was deleted

AttemptErrorCodes.description: Error code of the delivery attempt

attempt_number.description: Sequential number of attempts (up to and including this one) made for the associated event

requested_url.description: URL of the destination where delivery was attempted

http_method.description: HTTP method used to deliver the attempt

responded_at.description: Date the destination responded to this attempt

delivery_latency.description: Time elapsed between attempt initiation and final delivery (in ms)

response_latency.description: Time elapsed between attempt initiation and a response from the destination (in ms)

updated_at.description: Date the attempt was last updated

body.description: JSON or string representation of the body

is_large_payload.description: Whether the payload is considered large payload and not searchable

event_data_id.description: ID of the bookmarked event data

last_used_at.description: Date the bookmark was last manually triggered

updated_at.description: Date the bookmark was last updated

request_id.description: ID of the request that created the event

last_attempt_at.description: Date of the most recently attempted retry

next_attempt_at.description: Date of the next scheduled retry

successful_at.description: Date of the latest successful attempt

cli_id.description: ID of the CLI the event is sent to

updated_at.description: Date the event was last updated

DestinationRateLimitPeriod.description: Period to rate limit events by. Refered as Delivery Rate period in the dashboard and documentation.

DestinationHTTPMethod.description: HTTP method used on requests sent to the destination, overrides the method used on requests sent to the source.

DestinationAuthMethodSignatureConfig.description: Empty config for the destination's auth method

DestinationAuthMethodBasicAuthConfig.description: Basic auth config for the destination's auth method

key.description: Key for the API key auth

api_key.description: API key for the API key auth

to.description: Whether the API key should be sent as a header or a query parameter

token.description: Token for the bearer token auth

client_id.description: Client id in the auth server

client_secret.description: Client secret in the auth server

key.description: Key for the custom signature auth

signing_secret.description: Signing secret for the custom signature auth. If left empty a secret will be generated for you.

SourceAllowedHTTPMethod.description: List of allowed HTTP methods. Defaults to PUT, POST, PATCH, DELETE.

SourceCustomResponseContentType.description: Content type of the custom response

name.description: Name for the source

url.description: A unique URL that must be supplied to your webhook's provider

updated_at.description: Date the source was last updated

hostname.description: The custom hostname to attach to the project

name.description: A unique, human-friendly name for the transformation

env.description: Key-value environment variables to be passed to the transformation

updated_at.description: Date the transformation was last updated

RetryStrategy.description: Algorithm to use when calculating delay between retries

type.description: A retry rule must be of type `retry`

interval.description: Time in MS between each retry

count.description: Maximum number of retries to attempt

FilterRuleProperty.description: JSON using our filter syntax to filter on request headers

type.description: A filter rule must be of type `filter`
A transformation rule must be of type `transformation`

transformation_id.description: ID of the attached transformation object. Optional input, always set once the rule is defined

name.description: The unique name of the transformation

code.description: A string representation of your JavaScript (ES6) code to run

env.description: A key-value object of environment variables to encrypt and expose to your transformation code

transformation.description: You can optionally define a new transformation while creating a transform rule

type.description: A delay rule must be of type `delay`

name.description: Unique name of the connection for this source

full_name.description: Full name of the connection concatenated from source, connection and desitnation name

rules.description: Array of rules configured on the connection

updated_at.description: Date the connection was last updated

tags.name: Issue Triggers
tags.description: Issue Triggers lets you setup rules that trigger issues when certain conditions are met.

tags.name: Attempts
tags.description: An attempt is any request that Hookdeck makes on behalf of an event.

tags.name: Bookmarks
tags.description: A bookmark lets you conveniently store and replay a specific request.

tags.name: Destinations
tags.description: A destination is any endpoint to which your webhooks can be routed.

tags.name: Events
tags.description: An event is any request that Hookdeck receives from a source.

tags.name: Integrations
tags.description: An integration configures platform-specific behaviors, such as signature verification.

tags.name: Issues
tags.description: Issues lets you track problems in your project and communicate resolution steps with your team.

tags.name: Requests
tags.description: A request represent a webhook received by Hookdeck.

tags.name: Sources
tags.description: A source represents any third party that sends webhooks to Hookdeck.

tags.name: Notifications
tags.description: Notifications let your team receive alerts anytime an issue changes.

tags.name: Transformations
tags.description: A transformation represents JavaScript code that will be executed on a connection's requests. Transformations are applied to connections using Rules.

tags.name: Connections
tags.description: A connection lets you route webhooks from a source to a destination, using a ruleset.
